required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Difference of Plantar Pressure Distribution Between Surgical Treatment and Conservative Treatment for CAI
clinical_study.official_title: Difference of Plantar Pressure Distribution Between Surgical Treatment and Conservative Treatment for Chronic Ankle Instability

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study was to compare the difference of plantar pressure distribution between surgical treatment and conservative treatment for CAI.

detailed_description.textblock: The data of 20 patients who underwent surgery after reconstruction of the lateral collateral ligament of the ankle joint and 20 patients who underwent balance rehabilitation training were analyzed to compare the clinical effects of surgical treatment and conservative treatment for chronic ankle instability, in order to better guide the selection of the optimal intervention program for patients with chronic ankle joint.

primary_outcome.description: Foot and Ankle Ability Measure Activity

secondary_outcome.description: Identification of Functional Ankle Instability questionnaire
To evaluate the condition of lateral collateral ligament using magnetic resonance imaging

arm_group.description: Patients with CAI undergoing surgical treatment
Patients with CAI undergoing conservative treatment

intervention.description: Anatomical contraction and termination reconstruction of the lateral ligament

study_pop.textblock: From April 1, 2019, information of 20 patients diagnosed with CAI that underwent surgical treatment in our institute and 20 patients that underwent conservative treatment was collected and evaluated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with CAI
- The contralateral ankle joint is healthy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Accompanied by other musculoskeletal injuries
